intro: Arischrada dracocephaloides, commonly known as the dragonhead plant, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its square stems, opposite leaves, and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from purple to blue. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has a history of traditional medicinal use. The species is also valued for its ability to thrive in well-drained soils and full sun conditions.
